intro: Hieracium hanburyi, commonly known as Hanbury's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are hairy and often basal, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
